content.description: Nice movement to a crux 3/4 the way up. Classic.
content.location: Just right of "Blue Velvet." Start on ledge then left to first bolt.

content.description: Goes up the rightward arching arete. 5 stars in the guidebook!
content.location: Right of "Fragile Egos" it takes the arete heading towards "Blue Velvet". "Damn Yankees" is to the left 5.12b

content.description: This is a really cool and reletively long pockety line.  With a neat undercling-y and pocket-y crux right near the top, it is really fun.  Maybe a little hard for the grade but uber cool.
content.location: As you turn into the area from the railroad tracks it is on the right hand side of the free standing tower on your left.  As usual rap, don't lower, from the anchors on top.

content.description: Climb arete/face just to the left of of "Ego Tripping".   Leftmost bolted route/closest to tracks on southwest face.    May be in the low 5.9 range?   Avoid power lines (or grab them for the crux of your life)!

This route climbs the face behind the large tree in between "Electrocutioner" and "Into the Sun". Great face climbing on great holds. One of the more sustained 10a's at the falls, this one will test your patience if you're at your limit. 

   "The crux is pretty hard if you don't see it. I happened to see it the first time thus the 10a grade. Jack it and its definately harder. Sweet finish huh?"   -Jeff Frizzell (FA)
content.location: The start is located just behind a large tree. Look for the line of bolts up the face between "Electrocutioner" and "Into The Sun".

content.description: Another amazing route at railroad rock. Begin much like the other routes with easier climbing through mostly good pockets, before pulling the crux which involves monos, thin crimps, and maybe some deadpoints. A great route to do for those who have climbed Wild at Heart a few too many times and are looking for a little more of a challenge.
Back to back cruxes down low lead to easier terrain above.
content.location: This route is located on the right side of the wall, directly to the right of "Barbarians at the Gate", and to the left, around the arete of "Where's My Bourbon".

content.description: It was a fine day when Rich and Rob decided to equip this amazing line.  Beautiful pockets up the center of the corridor wall.  Right of Where's My Bourbon.  Not to be missed.
content.location: Railroad area, inside corridor, center of the wall, right of Where's my bourbon

content.description: Back to back boulder problems on pockets lead into fun, long moves between good crimps. Surpisingly powerful and dynamic compared to other routes at railroad rock, especially if you happen to find many of the holds just out of reach.
Technical with hidden holds around the right corner.
content.location: Arete far right from "Wild at Heart"

content.description: An amazing climb using a wide variety of holds. Keep it together for the crux near the top!
content.location: This route begins on top of the pile of large boulders at the base of Railroad Rock, and is found between "Wild at Heart" to the left, and "The Drifter" on the right.

content.description: Mostly shady and occasionaly damp, this area provides some of Jackson Falls's finest climbing and one of the hardest climbs.  This area is a bit of an approach, but well worth it.
